thread.title: Prep Roundup: Lake City girls soccer advances to title match - Fri, 23 Oct 2015 PST
thread.title_full: Prep Roundup: Lake City girls soccer advances to title match - Fri, 23 Oct 2015 PST

title: Prep Roundup: Lake City girls soccer advances to title match - Fri, 23 Oct 2015 PST
text:
Camryn Wendlant scored twice and the Lake City girls soccer team claimed a spot in Saturday’s 5A state title match with a 2-1 win over Mountain View Friday at Rocky Mountain High School in Meridian, Idaho. 
The Timberwolves (14-0-2) will play defending-champion Centennial at 1 p.m. at Meridian … 
Camryn Wendlant scored twice and the Lake City girls soccer team claimed a spot in Saturday’s 5A state title match with a 2-1 win over Mountain View Friday at Rocky Mountain High School in Meridian, Idaho. 
The Timberwolves (14-0-2) will play defending-champion Centennial at 1 p.m. at Meridian High School. Centennial advanced with a 1-0 overtime-win over Boise in a rematch of last year’s state title game. 
Coeur d’Alene 5, Skyline 2: Kylie Hanson scored twice and the Vikings (10-5-1) stayed alive with a win over the Grizzlies in a 5A state elimination match in Meridian. 
Maggie Vietri, Megan Drake and Maddie Morris also scored for Coeur d’Alene, which will play Rocky Mountain in the consolation finals Saturday in Meridian. 
Kuna 2, Sandpoint 1: Dreena Soto scored and the Kavemen benefited from an own goal in a 4A state tournament win over the defending-champion Bulldogs (7-7-3) in Caldwell, Idaho. 
Madison Schoening scored for Sandpoint, which was eliminated. 
Coeur d’Alene Charter 2, Timberlake 0: Cecelia McAfee scored in the first half and Mary Nicklay added a second-half goal as the defending-champion Panthers blanked Timberlake in a 3A state seminfinal match at Vallivue High School in Caldwell, Idaho. 
Coeur d’Alene Charter beat Timberlake 1-0 in last year’s state title match. 
The Panthers (15-5-1) will move on to play Weiser Saturday in Caldwell for this year’s state title. Timberlake (17-1-1) will play Marsh Valley Saturday for third place. GSL Girls Soccer: Bullpups finish undefeated in league play 
Larkin Russell scored two first-half goals and Gonzaga Prep finished undefeated in the Greater Spokane League with a 3-1 win over Mt. Spokane in a regular-season finale at Gonzaga Prep. 
Tayler Drynan added a 78th-minute goal for the Bullpups, who will host a District 8 4A match on Thursday. Gonzaga Prep will play the winner of Tuesday’s play-in match between Mead and Central Valley. 
University 2, Mead 0: Morgan Crosby scored in the first half and Brooke Berg added a second-half goal as the Titans secured the second seed in the GSL with a win over the visiting Panthers. Julia Adair assisted on both goals. 
University will host No. 3 Ferris on Thursday in a district semifinal match. 
Ferris 5, North Central 0: Bria Bowton had a second-half hat trick and the Saxons blanked the Indians in a GSL match at Ferris. 
Alexis Murphy added a goal and two assists for Ferris. North Central will play Shadle Park Wednesday in a District 8 3A match at Albi Stadium. The winner of that match will play at top-seeded Mt. Spokane on Friday to determine the top two seeds to regionals. 
Central Valley 5, Shadle Park 0: Maggie Ames had a first-half hat trick to power the Bears past the Highlanders at Merkel Field in Spokane. Kaelyn Barnes and Anna Hilbert also scored for Central Valley. Idaho Boys Soccer: Rocky Mountain tops Lake City in 5A semifinal 
Rocky Mountain topped Lake City 3-1 in a 5A state semifinal match at Eagle High School in Eagle, Idaho. 
Travis Swallow scored the Timberwolves’ lone goal. Lake City (13-1-2) will play Centennial Saturday in Eagle in the third-place match. 
Lakeland 3, Bishop Kelly 0: Daniel McDevitt, Juho Reiman and Brandon Lycan scored to lead the Hawks (14-2-2) past the Knights in a 4A state semifinal match in Caldwell. 
Lakeland will play Century Saturday at 1p.m. in the title match. 
Emmett 5, Bonners Ferry 2: Maxwell Gleim and Ramiro Alvizo scored two goals apiece and the Huskies defeated the Badgers in a 3A state elimination match at Vallivue High School. 
Daniel Streober scored both of Bonners Ferry’s goals. Volleyball: Bears sweep Saxons in GSL 
Keann White had nine kills and four blocks as Central Valley (9-0) swept Ferris (2-7) in a Greater Spokane League regular-season finale at Central Valley. Scores were 25-19, 25-13 and 25-6. 
Meghan Rockwood added 17 digs and Jake Rockwood chipped in 27 assists for Ferris.
